name: Quinoa Salad
description: Colorful vegetables and fresh herbs with protein-rich quinoa. Healthy grain salad full of fiber and nutrients.

instructions.instruction: Rinse quinoa thoroughly under cold running water in fine mesh strainer for 2 minutes.
Add quinoa and water to medium pot. Bring to boil.
Once boiling, reduce heat, cover, and simmer 15 minutes until water is absorbed.
instructions.tip: Don't lift lid while cooking - steam escapes.

instructions.instruction: Turn off heat, keep covered for 5 minutes. Then fluff with fork.
Spread quinoa on large tray to cool. Or quick-cool in refrigerator.
instructions.tip: Hot quinoa will cook vegetables - must cool first.

instructions.instruction: Make dressing: Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, zest, garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Chop all vegetables. Place in large salad bowl.
Add chopped fresh herbs (parsley and mint) to vegetables.
instructions.tip: Fresh herbs are the star of this salad - use generously.

instructions.instruction: Add cooled quinoa to vegetable mixture.
Gently fold with spatula or spoon.
instructions.tip: Don't stir vigorously - vegetables will get crushed.

instructions.instruction: Taste and adjust salt or lemon as needed.
Crumble feta on top if using.
Serve immediately or refrigerate 30 minutes for flavors to meld.

tips: Quinoa is a complete protein - contains all 9 essential amino acids.
Ideal for meal prep - keeps 4-5 days refrigerated.
Serve cold or at room temperature.
Naturally gluten-free grain - safe for celiac.
storageInfo: Refrigerate in airtight container for 4-5 days.
servingSuggestion: Serve alongside grilled meat or fish as side, or alone as light meal.
variations: Mediterranean: Add olives, sun-dried tomatoes, and artichokes.
Mexican: Add black beans, corn, and avocado.
Asian: Add edamame, sesame, and ginger-soy dressing.
Protein boost: Add chickpeas or grilled chicken.
